title: Anna Vakili is so successful post-Love Island her mother no longer needs to work
text:
Love Islands Anna (Picture: Backgrid)

Love Island star Anna Vakili has revealed she has been so successful since the show that her mother no longer needs to work.

Now that’s success.

Anna appeared on the 2019 series of the hit ITV dating show, and although she did not find love – and actually found herself caught in the snakey ways of Jordan Hames – she did leave the villa and nab herself several collaborations including working with her sister and shoe brand Simmi London.

All of which has led to what she describes as life-changing ‘for the better’.

‘I’m very grateful for all of the things that have come my way, but the best thing about it is my mum doesn’t have to work anymore,’ she told New magazine.

‘There have definitely been more ups than downs.’

Anna recently told Metro.co.uk that she had been targeted in online attacks with bullies branding her a ‘terrorist’ or using ‘Arab’ as a racial slur and at times found it hard to handle.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, Anna said: ‘It has affected me. [My sister Mandi] will be there to pick me up and tell me to ignore it.

‘I’ll be in bed really upset and she’ll sit on my bed with me and talk to me about it. No normal person does that, sits and insults someone like that.’

Anna was targeted more than the other Islanders while on the show (Picture: ITV)

The former pharmacist – who has no intention of returning to her former career – previously said she felt like she got targeted more than the other Islanders.

‘The thing I love about black communities is that they stick together, but Middle Easterns … they don’t have that support,’ she claimed.

‘When I’m getting DMs like “you Arab ****”, “you terrorist”, stuff like that is a sensitive topic and people were getting at me about that.’
